definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The Jade Emperor asked the Earth God to inform all the animals about this news.
sentences.chinese: 玉皇大帝就通知土地公去公佈一個消息。

sentences.english: One legend features the Jade Emperor, also known as the Emperor of Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 有一個傳說的主角是玉皇大帝，又稱元始天尊。

sentences.english: At that moment, the Jade Emperor flew past on a turbulent cloud, waving his arms.
sentences.chinese: 在那時，玉皇大帝揮舞著雙手，乘著一片亂雲飛過。

sentences.english: Jade Emperor decreed to hold a competition.
sentences.chinese: 於是，玉皇大帝決定舉行一場比賽。

sentences.english: The legend goes that Wang was a warrior of Emperor Yuhuang guarding Lingxiao Palace.
sentences.chinese: 傳說王靈官原爲玉皇大帝凌霄寶殿前的一名武士。

sentences.english: The Jade Emperor, the highest god in Heaven, vowed to avenge the swan.
sentences.chinese: 天界最高神玉皇大帝因此發誓爲天鵝報仇。

sentences.english: Do good deeds to earn the blessings of the Jade Emperor.
sentences.chinese: 行善積德，自有玉皇大帝保佑。

definition: another name for Xi Wangmu 西王母, Queen Mother of the West
Laozi or Lao-tze (c. 500 BC), Chinese philosopher, the founder of Taoism/the sacred book of Daoism, 道德經|道德经 by Laozi
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]/Son Goku, the main character in Dragon Ball 七龍珠|七龙珠[Qi1 long2 zhu1]
celestial troops and generals (idiom)/fig. superior forces
Great Sage the Equal of Heaven, self-proclaimed title of the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
Daoist immortal/supernatural entity/(in modern fiction) fairy, elf, leprechaun etc/fig. lighthearted person
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
